Author: tlrobinson
Content:
Nice thinly veiled attempt at spam, though I admit I like the game:

1) Why is it a Facebook app? I feel like people are making things into Facebook apps for the sake of making Facebook apps, even when there's really no good reason to.

2) You really need to make it ajaxy, there's no reason to force a reload of the page every move.

Title: On Facebook, Scholars Link Up With Data

Title: Rails 2.0.2 just released, so what's new?

Author: tlrobinson
Content: Personally I prefer TCP/IP via bongo drums (http://eagle.auc.ca:80/~dreid/) or carrier pigeons (http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1149.txt?number=1149).

Author: tlrobinson
Content:
I think the point is that ground work is in place for future plans that will make use of such features. Whether such things pan out is another thing.

"Microsoft want the DRM themselves because it puts them in a position of power over their competitors. They want Windows to be the OS that can play movies and music and other OS's to be shut out in the cold."

That pretty much sums it up. No good can come of this.
